author: Special Correspondent
text:
Kannada film producer Shashikumar attempted to kill himself in Kamakshipalya on Friday afternoon.

The police believe that his failure to release a film he had produced nearly two years ago could have driven him to take such a step.

The producer was found unconscious in his car that was parked near a bus stand. The family members rushed him to a private hospital, where he is being treated.

Shashikumar had produced a Kannada movie Half Mental , at a cost of about Rs. 3.25 crore.

For a year-and-a-half, he had been trying to release it, but was unable to do so because of non-availability of dates with distributors and theatres.

Loan

According to the police, Shashikumar, who had already taken a huge loan for his film, was asked to arrange for Rs. 80 lakh for its release. This could be the reason he attempted to kill himself, the police said.

Industrialist critical

A 35-year-old man was found lying on a pavement frothing in the mouth on Rhenius Street, Richmond Town, on Friday morning. Passers-by shifted him to a nearby hospital. The man, identified as Kodanda Reddy, a resident of Madivala and a textile industrialist, is said to be critical.

The Ashok Nagar police said that preliminary inquiries revealed that he had consumed some kind of poison in a bid to end his life.

Family members

“We have informed his family members, and due to his condition, he has been shifted to another hospital,” said a police officer.

A case is yet to be registered as the police have not yet recorded Mr. Reddy’s statement.

title: Kannada film producer attempts suicide
